description.narrative: By end 2021, actors at central and local levels have the capacity to lead the planning, programming, budgeting and monitoring and evaluation of policies and programmes addressing child rights

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation
Policy dialogue and advocacy on decentralization coordination and implementation

title.narrative: Chad Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Social Inclusion)
Chad United Nations Development Assistance Framework
"UNICEF Programmes in Chad (Social Policy Planning Monitoring and Evaluation)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Chad 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Chad Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, actors at central and local levels have the capacity to lead the planning, programming, budgeting and monitoring and evaluation of policies and programmes addressing child rights

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support Government efforts to strengthen capacities of the relevant actors towards developing public policies and resource allocations that respond to the key priorities of children, in support of implementation of the National Development Plan 2017-2021, especially axis 4, which aims to develop human capital and improve the living conditions of the population. 38 local actors (members of Provincial Action Committees) of Lac, Bahr Ghazel, Hadjer Lamis and Kanem provinces were trained in social protection, including shock-responsive social protection, and 35 executives of social ministries acquired competencies in budgeting for priority action plans. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:08/02/2020

title.narrative: Local governments (incl. municipalities) with development plans that include specific activities that address child priorities
Nombre d'acteurs cls forms sur les stratgies oprationnelles de transferts sociaux
Politique / stratgie: Existence d'une stratgie politique nationale de protection sociale mise a jour
Les partenariats pour le financement des secteurs sociaux renforces
